Hi Lauren,Thank you so much for your honest review. It was very unfortunate what happened with Amber and we are so very sorry for your loss. We received Amber into our care as a walk-in emergency case when we were already fully booked, recognizing that she was severely injured and was actively bleeding. Dr. Regan immediately placed her as priority above our other non-emergent patients at the time who had appointments booked, and also chose not to charge an emergency fee to you and your family.Due to the severity of her injuries from being attacked, the most humane thing to do is to administer pain control to alleviate the pain from the multiple puncture wounds found on her neck and head. With pain medications on board, Amber will hopefully be more comfortable before we proceed with other possible treatments  i.e putting in an IV catheter, administering fluids, doing a small blood draw to check if she is anemic from blood loss, or even x-rays to check how severe her injuries were. Imagine having a broken bone, and your doctor needed to take x-rays of it without giving you any pain control. That would be extremely painful and horrible to go through, and we do not wish that upon our patients.We try to keep our patients as calm and comfortable as possible, and we wish we could have done more to help Amber. However sometimes even our best is not enough in emergency situations like this.Deepest Condolences,Marielle l Hospital Coordinator

Dear Anthony,We are really sorry that you are upset and really value both you and your spouse as patients. There are a few things that you possibly weren’t aware of and we hope this will clear things up for you:1) King East Dental is a general dentistry office.  There is currently not an oral surgeon at the office and there never has been an oral surgeon at this office.  An exam with a general dentist and imaging is usually required to get a referral to a specialist’s office.2) The dentist was asked by your spouse to check more than one area. Imaging and treatment planning was done for more treatment other than just the extraction.3) Your spouse can be treated at our office for everything planned (including the extraction) but it will have to be delayed due to a recent health reason that was not revealed to the dentist until the patient was examined.  The specialist referral was only given if the extraction is needed urgently as his safety is of importance to us.4)The dentist actually reduced the price of the examination fee by around 50% for your spouse.Please know that you both can contact us at any point if you need any further clarification or assistance.We really hope to continue our relationship with you.Sincerely,King East Dental

Hi there, Thank you for sharing your feedback and sorry for not meeting your expectation. Upon reviewing our records, we do not have your name in our system as a client. However, we would be happy to discuss this further if you could provide us with your and your pet's information so that we can address your concerns directly.Regarding your comments about pricing, please note that our fees are determined based on market conditions and in accordance with the fee guide provided by the Ontario Veterinary Medical Association (OVMA). We aim to maintain transparency with our pricing and always ensure that our clients are informed about the costs of any procedures or tests prior to proceeding.As for the documentation for travel, we understand the importance of accurate and timely paperwork. However, it is a legal requirement for us to have your pet present at the time of examination, and for the doctor to verify and sign off on the health status. If the timeline was incorrect or needed adjustments, it would necessitate a new examination and form completion. We rely on owners to inform us of their specific timelines and needs so that we can provide the appropriate services.Please contact us directly at info@wellesleyanimalhospital.ca, and we will do our best to address your concerns.Thank you for bringing this to our attention.Sincerely,Carissa TPractice Manager

Patient care is always our priority.A core teaching in medicine is that there is no guarantee that you can only have one problem at a time. In fact over time, one problem often leads to another. I would suggest that Google reviews may not be best place to allege that a crime has taken place. The College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario routinely audits physicians in Ontario. If you have a concern about either our patient management or billing practices, you can reach them at www.cpso.on.ca. I would be happy to review your medical treatment with yourself and the CPSO at any time.I will note that we proudly have never had a "one-issue-per-visit" policy at our clinic - it is one of Patient Networks' founding principles.

Hi Tahemin,We're sorry to hear you weren't satisfied with your recent lip blushing! We hope this will change over time, as the pigment in lip blushing usually takes several weeks to reappear on the lips after treatments.The pain in lip blushing certainly varies from person to person, which is why we use multiple numbing agents to minimize discomfort. While I know you had your reservations about the pain after your original appointment, your technician was under the impression the adjusted numbing regiment used at your touch-up had made a dramatic difference with pain reduction. If that wasn't the case, we'd love to hear more about your experience in order to prevent issues with other clients, and we've reached out to you directly in regards to this.Since we mix a custom hue for each client doing lip blushing, we often show the mixture itself rather than using a colour book to show the finished colour. This is especially true in cases where the lips are darker and require neutralization, as everyone's lips react differently to the same pigments.We'll reach out directly again 5 weeks after your appointment to see how things have settled. I know the pigment disappearing can be nerve-wracking, but it's an expected part of the healing process.Thanks,The Beauty House Team

All Covid-19 guidelines have been followed.  We have communicated with Health Board multiple times to ensure that we properly operate under the Provincial laws as well as local by-laws.It is a hard time for many and we do not downplay that what so ever.  We've invested thousands of dollars to create as safe of an environment as we can.  Our issues are with the selective measures that are being taken by the Government.  Restaurants have had very little impact on the number of Covid-19 cases in London and other areas.  Yet we face some of the harshest guidelines throughout different industries.  We are the only industry that is dictated hours of operation.  Our capacity is now limited to 10 people (same are gyms) where as retail stores can operate at a much greater number.  Restaurants, as well as other stores, are required to screen every person coming in. I've yet to come across one "Big Box" store that follows this guideline (small retail stores pay for an employee to screen at the entrance).  The Ale House, like many other places, have had to layoff many employees that we value greatly.  We are "fighting" (being vocal) for them as well as all other businesses that are struggling through these times.

I would like to express my deepest condolences for the loss of your cat, he was obviously loved dearly. I understand that coping with your loss must have only been made more difficult with the delays in cremation deliveries from our third party cremation company.Upon learning about your initial frustration with the speed of the cremation services, I was personally upset about your situation and contacted the cremation company myself to determine the cause of the delivery delay.  They stated that you had purchased a special paw print item which indicated, on their third party website, at the time of purchase, that it will take 3 to 4 weeks for shipment.  At this point it had been less than 4 weeks since the time of purchase.  I was also informed that due to COVID there was an additional 1 week delay in shipment.  We then proceeded to inform you of the reason for the delay.  Since you had selected a special paw print that none of our clients had ever purchased in the past, we were not aware that the shipment would take more than the typical 1-2 weeks for delivery. However, our third party cremation services website stated this clearly when you purchased the item. We then proceeded to split up the shipments for you as you requested so that you could have your beloved pets remains more promptly.As far as prices for services and clarity of communications, I have only interacted with your partner when discussing your cats very serious condition.  I had been strongly urging your partner to proceed with surgical treatment for your pets condition, suggesting external surgical specialist treatment (with absolutely no monetary benefit to us).  I had several lengthy telephone conversations, without charge, with your husband detailing possible treatment plans and encouraging surgery to attempt to save your cats life.  You elected to treat medically the condition and we continued to refill medications for 1 year without rechecking your pet or checking blood tests, in direct consideration of your cost concerns.  Our veterinary regulatory body requires us to examine a patient at least yearly in order to continue to prescribed chronic medications.  After a year we retested your cats blood, with an extensive blood test, considering the seriousness of your cats eventually fatal condition.You have not personally been directly involved in any communications regarding your pets illness.  Hopefully the above explanation clarifies that I have been considerate of balancing your cost concerns with attempting to treat your cats life threatening illness.

Hello Yady,I am very sorry to hear that your recent experience at our clinic did not meet your expectations. The reason you had initially requested an appointment with us was to discuss ways that we can help get your rescue dog groomed as a few grooming facilities that you tried to take him too were unsuccessful in the past and your previous vet clinic had to resort to fully sedating him for shave downs. You also made it clear that he is extremely reactive, dislikes being groomed, tries to bite and that no one has been able to put a muzzle on him so far. Our veterinarian along with our technicians were eventually able to examine your pet but as you can imagine it was not the easiest task as he was quite reactive. We were able to listen to his heart and lungs which sounded normal, though a full examination was not possible given his temperament. Our veterinarian did go through a few options on how we can prescribe some anxiety medications that can help make future in clinic visits less stressful, all of which were then declined.  Our priority is to provide a safe and fear-free experience for our patients both for medical appointments and grooming services. Since this was our first time meeting Zachy, it was important for our veterinarian to gauge the level of anxiety that Zachy exhibits in clinic in order to provide a treatment plan for moving forward. I apologize that the treatment plan offered was not the one you had hoped for, however considering your pet's history of fear based aggression, it is recommended that he be sedated for grooming to reduce the risk of him injuring himself or others during the process. Ultimately our goal is to advocate for our patients, and our hope is that we can work together with you to navigate Zachy's needs.Please feel free to reach out to us directly to discuss further.Melanie, Practice Manager

Dear Tiffany,Our services do start at $150+HST for the home visit (this includes the mobile/booking and pet examination fee).  This is clearly stated on the webpage that you used to book your home visit with us.  It is also noted on the invoice you received from your online booking, and the Customer Service Representative you spoke with on the phone confirmed with you that our veterinary services start at $150+HST.  So it is not clear how you came to the conclusion that a pet euthanasia done at your home would cost $150.  Our home euthanasia appointments require a lot of preparation and include aftercare options such as transportation of your pet after he/she has been euthanized from your home to the crematorium, cremation, ashes return, and keepsakes.  There’s a lot of time, thought, and labor involved in these more intimate and personalized visits.As for the email Dr. Tina sent you, you did express during your consultation with Dr. Tina that you were adamant about proceeding with euthanasia for your diabetic cat as you could not afford your previous veterinarian's treatment plan to start treatment for her.  You even rejected Dr. Tina’s suggestion of surrendering Jimmy to the Humane Society for re-adoption.   Dr. Tina ended the visit with you by offering you her deepest condolences for this painful decision, and you seemed to acknowledge and appreciate her compassion for your situation.  Dr. Tina only merely referenced this again in her follow-up email to you.We are all pet owners here at this service.  We understand how difficult it can be to say goodbye to a pet, and so I hope you don’t misconstrue Dr. Tina’s heartfelt message speaking to the decision you had made regarding Jimmy as anything other than that.-------------We would like to kindly remind everyone that we do offer Phone Consults, which is a service that connects you directly with one of our veterinarians over the phone.  During this phone conversation the veterinarian will answer any general questions about our service, address any specific medical concerns you may have about your pet, and provide you with a plan of care tailored to your specific needs along with a quote for your home visit.Respectfully,Dmitry, Office Manager of the Toronto Mobile Veterinary Services.

It is up to the doctor if a prescription will be given or not.  Having a sore throat does not mean you will get a prescription and waiting in walk-in does not mean you will get a prescription. While we strive to provide the best service to clients and the most comfortable experience for our patients, this is not always possible with anxious pets. From my understanding, your puppy was not cooperative upon examination by the doctor. For the safety of our staff members, the pet owners, and the patients themselves, we must take preventative measures such as restraint with cone/muzzle, intramuscular sedation (which would have been difficult given that not even you were able to safely muzzle or restrain him), or pre-medications which were prescribed to you for future veterinary visits. To accommodate for how anxious he was, with the help of several technicians the doctor was able to quickly administer the vaccines, and prescribed conservative eye medications for his conditions. We do apologize for not having a new cone at hand for when he came in, as our regular Elizabethan collars are soft and made of fabric, his teeth would have easily broke through if he wished to bite.

Dear Ms. Leslie Cook,At this time, our standard mobile/booking fee is $120+HST, as is listed on our website. This initial upfront cost can be higher if, for example, there is more than one pet to be seen; if the patron's address is outside of our general service boundaries; if our patron is requesting veterinary home care service outside of our regular business hours (should it be available). In this way, the mobile/booking fee for a home visit in Hamilton, for example, would be higher than the mobile/booking fee for a home visit in North York. Unfortunately, this reviewer did not include this information, so we are not able to verify the accuracy of her statement.We would like to note that bringing a veterinary hospital to a private home does take a lot of thought, organization, and effort.  This process starts right from the minute the initial upfront mobile/booking fee is taken and includes (but not limited to): reserving a veterinarian and nurse's standby time for the booked visit; driving route pre-planning and scheduling which accounts for our pets' specific needs and locations; pre-arrangement of patient-specific medication and equipment in packages - including disinfection as per COVID-19 standards - for loading into the vehicle on appointment day; and other tasks.We would also like to take this opportunity to remind our clients and interested patrons that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, appointments do take longer than usual as we need additional time to disinfect and sanitize our PPE, veterinary equipment, and the area in the home where we set up our temporary veterinary clinic, all to minimize the risk of transmission, so please plan your home visit accordingly. We value the safety of our pet guardians and staff highly, and are doing everything we can to protect our wonderful community of pets and pet guardians, especially considering that many of our clients are seniors, immune-compromised individuals, families with small children, and disabled persons.Respectfully,Dmitry, Office Manager of the Toronto Mobile Veterinary Services.

Hi Marilyn, Firstly, we would like to tell you how sorry we are for your loss of Summer. We understand how hard it is, especially when you've done as much as you can to fight for her. Summer was a lovely dog, and we know how much she meant to you and your family. We will miss her.We'd like to address the concerns you've raised here. We appreciate the expense that you went to to help Summer live long and well. Please know that we did our best to help achieve this for her and you, both, and it was never our intention to make you feel the way you've mentioned here. We do see from our records that our team (both Dr. Finora as well as his technician) had been in touch with you as to the reason we recommended seeing your rDVM first, as well as having offered options for seeing us, if needed. If you want to discuss it further, please do give us a call. Please understand that when we've been informed that a patient will be euthanized, we will not call a client to confirm this for the sake of the sensitive and difficult time they may be having. We apologize if we did not reach out in a manner you'd expected, but we do hope you received the acknowledgment of her passing that we sent at the time.Regarding Summer's life expectancy, while we may have data-supported outlooks for the conditions we treat our patients for, we cannot make guarantees. Medicine is not perfect, and therefore, we cannot perfectly anticipate what may happen in the future. We do wish that Summer had had longer with you to enjoy her remission, and we're sorry that she took a turn so soon and it was not so. If you have any questions or concerns, please reach us by phone or email - we'd be happy to help however we might. Please take care and we wish you peace.

Hello Adertisix Toronto, Our sincere condolences for your family’s loss. We completely understand what a devastating and frustrating time this must have been for your family especially during these unprecedented times. Thank you for providing this feedback. We are saddened to hear that your family were disappointed with the service that was provided by our team. We understand how hard it is for new clients to a clinic to get an appointment during these times so our team went above and beyond to fit your little one in for an appointment during a day which we were already fully booked. Our team followed our standard protocols for a euthanasia. As this pet was new to our clinic the doctor had to perform an examination in order to establish a Vet-Client-Patient-Relationship before any medical procedure can be performed, which does incur a standard examination fee. Our team got the patient checked in and then provided the appropriate documentation to sign before any procedures/preparations can be performed. Our hospital procedure is to have payment taken before any treatment/procedure begins as in our experience clients prefer to have everything done before hand so that they can spend every precious moment afterwards focusing on their pet. During Covid times our company policy is to allow 1 person in with their pet during a euthanasia. This was even more relevant during the timing of the appointment as we as a city/community were right in the middle of the Omicron wave of Covid-19. As your family were new to our clinic, they would not have been used to our policies and we apologize that they may have seemed different, but these policies are what have worked for our team for a long time. Our team continue to do their very best to be able to continue to be there for the people and pets of this community and follow certain policies and protocols to do so. If the person who is named on the file would like to speak to us further then they can contact us at 416-690-0625 or reception@vetstoronto.com Warm regards, Fiona. Practice Manager

We acknowledge that veterinary appointments can involve a lot of information, especially when addressing the health concerns of a pet, and it can be challenging to absorb all the details, especially in stressful situations.During the appointment, the veterinarian explored various medications and treatment options while being mindful of cost considerations. There was a particular emphasis on the potential risks associated with certain medications. The vet was cautious and sought to discuss the most effective and lasting solutions for your cat's dental issues.To address your concerns about over-the-counter products, the vet did provide information as per your request. However, it was clarified that these might serve more as maintenance rather than a comprehensive solution to the underlying dental problems.In an effort to ensure clarity and address any lingering questions, would it be acceptable for one of our veterinarians to give you a call? They can go over the details of the appointment again, providing a thorough explanation of the proposed treatment plan. We want to ensure that you have a comprehensive understanding of your pet's health needs and the associated costs.Thank you for your understanding, and we look forward to the opportunity to discuss this further with you.

Splints are not a permanent solution, but a means of stabilizing an injury that requires further care. They can and do shift with movement of the patient; this is unavoidable and not evidence that the splint was placed incorrectly. We waive our consultation fee if a patient needs to return within 24 hours of their initial visit, but if they return outside that window, there is another consult fee charged. In general, we do need to charge for our time and supplies. We strive to be transparent about the costs of treatment and always discuss potential expenses with pet owners to ensure they are well-informed. Due to the extent of Cee Cee's illness and the 24/7 care she would need in ICU this is something your RDVM would be unable to provide and unfortunately the costs associated with this care are higher.If there is anything we can do to assist you or if you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at Manager@tahp.vet

The reason there is an exam required prior to any sort of service is because the doctor needs to assess the pet to ensure the treatment plan is appropriate for their specific case. By trying to get it right the first time instead of blindly running tests can actually save you money and allow your pet to receive appropriate medical treatment faster. It’s also a legal requirement to create a veterinarian-client-patient relationship prior to initiating any treatments on an animal as per our governing body, the CVO. If a client has a specific service in mind regarding their pet’s care, we encourage them to discuss it with the doctor at the time of the appointment. We are more than happy to work with respectful clients regarding various treatment options that will work best for their pet.

Kelly,I am so sorry for Meaw’s loss; it is always difficult to see our loved ones go especially when this is somehow unexpected. I understand your concern and it is also troubling for me to see a patient dying in the circumstance that Meaw did. I reviewed his file and all the calculations for the medications were appropriate for a patient of his age, medical state and weight.  At this point I am uncertain of the reason for his death. Perhaps this may be related with the chronic diarrhea that was affecting him for some time before this visit.  In order to clarify your concerns and also help us to provide the best advice to any other patient in the future, I still encourage you to consider an autopsy on Meaw (as we discussed over the phone). I recommend you to do this by an independent board certified pathologist (University of Guelph is an option). Our hospital can carry the cost of this test as it is very important for us to improve every day and provide the best advice always.  I consider that this test may give you some peace of mind about the cause of Meaw's death and also allow us to learn about  the case.  Please consider our suggestion and do not hesitate to contact us so we can guide you through the process or we can clarify any other concerns or questions that you have.

Toronto Mobile Veterinary Services is a small but growing service that relies on booking automation to allow for scheduling of our pet patients in a timely and efficient way. The quick response our booking process provides has been especially important during this COVID-19 pandemic with its surge in distressed pet owners seeking help. When a client requests a time slot that is no longer available, our system automatically prompts one of our third-party phone representatives to phone the client and assist them. This reviewer was fully aware of this policy when she made her booking on our website as she selected the option reading: "I am a NEW CLIENT… Only provide a PHONE CALL if my requested time slot is not available."As our mobile medical system is not set up for primary communications through texts/emails, we did do our best to send this person some helpful suggestions for working out the details of her booking and of the veterinary consultation to follow. One of these suggestions was to have a friend or family member assist her in speaking to our veterinary support team on her behalf. The special-needs clients we have served in the past have used this method to communicate with our healthcare team. There was no intention to offend her in any way. From our experience with working with deaf or hard-of-hearing clients, there are also a number of government-funded interpreter and relay services and even phone apps that specifically assist individuals with making phone calls (if friends and family are not available). We are not sure why this reviewer declined to contact us using one of these readily-available services.Finally, we would like to respond specifically to the last line in this person's review:  "*I did warn the clinic that I was going to write a negative review in my 3rd report* - they have not responded to me." The Toronto Mobile Veterinary Services has a policy of refusing service to individuals who attempt to bully, intimidate, and/or blackmail our hardworking staff who are already doing their very best to help as many pets they can - especially during this unprecedented pandemic that is affecting everyone.Respectfully,Dmitry, Office Manager at the Toronto Mobile Veterinary Services.

Mrs. Rax thank you for bringing this to our attention. While we are thrilled that you enjoyed a great meal with Fanny's great service, we're truly sorry for any confusion caused over your credit card charge. The pending charge amount is not always what will actually be posted to your account, and this is because a merchant may pre-authorize an amount before the transaction’s complete. This is often to make sure there are enough funds available before putting a charge through. In the case of dining at a restaurant, it's not uncommon for your issuer to preauthorizes an additional 20% to allow room for tips, which was the case here. Just because it was preauthorized doesn't mean it was actually posted to your account, and we're sorry it caused any worry. When it comes to the case of getting change back, please let us know if there's an error -- we do our very best to make sure everything is accurate, but if there's been a mistake, we want to know so we can correct it. We've been serving our community for over 60 years, and our reputation is very important to us. We would never take advantage of our customers.Btw, we're happy to see you both came back today.  You're probably clear up all confusions about the pending transaction charge, and knew how it works.The system is generated automatically and just have to patiently wait for the processing time, it's out of our control.  We have been business over 60 years and always try to serve great Chinese food & provide friendly service.Occasionally, we have to absorb some negative reviews just because the customers misunderstood and got upset w little thing posted bad reviews about us.  I hope you're realize by now that we did nothing wrong but just to please customers!Twin Dragon Management

Hi there Mrs. Mitchell. We firstly would like to thank you for your business in purchasing your 2009 Land Rover LR3 with 161,000km (purchase April 10th 2018). We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced and take your feedback very seriously. On the issue of a small plastic piece missing we did in fact send it by mail. The apparent fact that it did not reach you may indicate the package was lost or something of that nature. A simple phone call to us would have cleared up the issue rather quickly. On to the subject of the tires. Upon purchase we certify the vehicle with a licensed mechanic with many years of experience so to say that they were the wrong size seems a little odd but again, could've been easily resolved with a phone call to us. Hubs/wheel bearings can wear out over time. They will often make an obvious humming noise while driving which will indicate that they may need to be looked at. They were not making any noise whatsoever at the time you purchased the vehicle and if they were we would have attended to the issue. This issue most likely took place a while after you bought the vehicle (purchased the vehicle over a year ago April 10th 2018). On the issue of the fluids (engine oil, transmission oil,etc) these are part of regular maintenance and not part of a safety certification. This is something we always make very clear to our clients during the purchase process. In terms of the Battery and alternator these issues usually come about from accidentally leaving a light,radio or something battery-consuming on. Being only a month after purchasing we would've assisted you with that if you would've called us. We cannot help with an issue if we are unaware of the issue. All in all we apologize again for any inconvenience you may have experienced with your vehicle but also understand that the mechanics you took it to are in the business of making money so be sure to take it to a mechanic you can trust because 12k seems a little steep for the issues you've mentioned. If you'd like to contact us about the matter please feel free 416 645 0196!

Hello Elika,I'm very sorry to hear about your experience. The reason why your pet waited for so long in the clinic is that you are scheduled for a drop off appointment that you agreed on, where your pet is seen in between the doctors appointments, we do try our best to explain to everyone what this entails and that your pet will be seen depending on how the day goes. Even though the clinic is busy at all times we are not keen of rushing any services/care that we provide to the pets who come in the hospital and this doesn't mean that we intend to ignore any drop offs who are waiting, we try our best everyday to attend to everyone efficiently. I understand that the price was different for your two pets however we do have different exam fees for young(kittens/puppy's exam fee are $59+tax) and for adult cats/dogs the exam fee is $87+tax, as much as we value your pets and prioritise their health we also need to consider the staff's safety, the reason why we recommend sedation to continue with the exam is because the more that we force to examine your pet while they're stressed, the more we are giving a traumatic experience for them which we do not want. We also wanted to make clear that we would never prescribed an antibiotic when a pet wasn't examined, it might be that the doctor wanted to prescribed a medication that will help your pet be more relaxed/calmed on their next visit.Every pet who comes in the clinic and every client who trust us is very important to us, we understand that our services and recommendations wasn't the best option for you. We hope you would find a place that can best fit your needs. We appreciate your feedback and we'll surely use this as a tool to improve our services moving forward.
Thank you for your review! Congratulations on getting your first car! We are always happy to help.

Background:  This vehicle, a 2014 Dodge Pro Master van, was purchased from the customer's employer 44% below the market price on auto trader. The car was parked for one year and not used at all by the previous owner. You came to me in October to make the necessary repairs to pass the safety inspection.

Every step of the repairs I kept you informed of the progress made. I still have the photos and videos that I sent you of the damage. Regarding your claims:

1. I sent you camera footage of the damages and the extent of the repair of extracting the bolts. It is a common issue with this vehicle for the bolts to rust out, as there is no beauty cover to protect it from water running down it. 
2. The intake manifold needed to be purchased from the dealer. I had checked with all the wreckers to try and keep the cost down but could not find one as the vehicle was too new. Unfortunately,  due to the scarcity of new parts, it took two weeks to get the part, which I had informed you ahead of time. 
3.  The claim that I used a "used oil filter" is false. I installed a new engine oil cooler with all the gaskets. The new oil cooler always comes with a brand new filter. You are more than welcome to check that. I also suspect that Mr Lube made that claim to secure your business as an ongoing customer. I had another customer tell me that Mr Lube told him the same thing, and that he had previously taken it to Costco. A filter after a couple of months, driven in the winter will not look new, and they may have even shown you a different filter, just so they can get your business in the future. 
4.  Your claim on damaging the transmission is impossible. I did no repairs to the transmission or anything that effects the transmission. You drove the vehicle from October to January without any issue. 
5. Wooden screws?  I think you made a typo and meant to refer to screws used for wood.  Screws and bolts were used to secure the intake manifold. 

I have to admit that I am disappointed with your review. I did everything possible to keep costs to a minimum. I kept you informed and got your permission every step of the way. Provided you with photos and video of what was wrong and what I did to fix things. I asked you to contact me if there were any issues,  and unfortunately you did not. I even tried to reach out to you after you left this review but you never responded. 

I understand that cost of car repairs can be upsetting, and you are trying to put the blame somewhere, but I stand by my work and I have photos and videos. Unfortunately it seems you have been mislead by other mechanics to secure your business.  I think a lot of misunderstanding could have been avoided if you contaced me.

Sir within a 2 hour period, you had two rounds of shots as well as two round of beers. Can post receipt to prove. At the Avenue , we take intoxication very seriously as it may result in danger to yourself and to the public. However, you missed the part of the story where you took a picture of that “one guy” and told your friend you were sending the picture to the owner and getting him fired. Turned out that “one guy” was the owner In future if you or anyone is looking  for a place that accommodates  over drinking, then you are correct Avenue definitely is not the place for you .

Dear Mr. LeatWe are glad to hear that you are happy with your vehicle. I would like to point out that your review is factually inaccurate. Nowhere on your bill of sale/contract does it say that Car Solutions Canada would  provide winter tires nor did you pay for any additional tires as you state in your review. Your bill of sale clearly states that we will “check for winter tires”.In fact, you received a discount off the sale price of the vehicle and the salesman told you ifthe car already came with winter tires when it arrived at the dealership (sometimes vehicles we purchase come in with 2 sets of tires), they would be stored in the back of the dealership and if we had them, we were happy to offer them to you at no extra charge. The salesman checked the back to see if we had any at the time of purchase, and he advised you at that time that we did not. He further offered that if a set of winter tires that match your car do come in to the dealership with a different car in the short future, we would call you and offer those to you. Unfortunately, that did not happen. Every time you called the dealership over the next several months, the salesman took your call and checked again to see if we had winter tires we could give you for free, but there was nothing available.It seems that you misunderstood the arrangement at the time of purchase. It feels like you are attempting to intimidate or bully us into providing you with a free set of tires through posting a bad review. This is not only hurtful but very disappointing as the salesman that helped you really went above and beyond with the customer service provided to you. Perhaps you are correct.......and thank you for making this crystal clear to us........that we shouldn’t offer anything as a courtesy unless it is in fact paid for.Although we strive to ensure that all our customers have an excellent experience, this does not include giving things away for free.Best Regards,Car Solutions Canada Inc. Hello Shezan,We appreciate that you have taken the time to let us know your concerns. We would have loved the opportunity to discuss them in person during your visit, but at the time we were not given any indication that you were unsatisfied, considering that you scheduled a dental surgery with a specific request for Dr. Asotra for a few days later.We have made significant changes in staffing and protocol in the 5+ years since those negative Yelp reviews were made, and we fully stand behind the recommendations of our doctors. Dr. Asotra is a Fear Free certified veterinarian, meaning she implements numerous tactics to earn our patients’ trust and put them at ease while at the clinic; one of these tactics is giving easy-to-chew Benny Bullies to create a positive association with the doctor without inflicting pain while they chew.  We have had positive feedback from our clients regarding our Fear Free practices and we continue to use them confidently.We would never force anyone into any treatment for their pet, and, had you expressed concerns about the doctor’s recommendations during your visit, she would have been more than happy to discuss, clarify, and explain them to you further.Dr. Asotra could absolutely tell that you care very much about Sophie. You expressed that you wanted to make sure she was not in pain while waiting for her surgery, so Dr. Asotra proceeded to prescribe pain medication for her. She also prescribed an antibiotic to prevent infection from developing.  The antibiotics that were given to Sophie had not yet expired but were indeed expiring at the end of February.  If they were given as prescribed, then Sophie would have finished the course of medication far ahead of the date of expiration.While we do happily offer free dental assessments with our technicians, a broken tooth is a medical condition that requires a doctor's assessment and thereby a consultation fee.  The appointment included a head-to-toe examination to determine if Sophie is fit for anesthesia for her dental surgery, as well as an in-depth conversation of treatment options and the risks and benefits of each option.Our main priority is Sophie's health and welfare.  Although the dental surgery was not performed by us, we are happy to know that she received the care she needed.Melanie, Practice Manager

You brought your puppy as a Walk-In emergency visit 2 hours before closing, our doctor then examined your puppy, discussed her inital findings and potential toxicity/neurological issues and recommended that you take your puppy to a 24 hour emergency hospital where if necessary they could provide the required testing and monitoring over night.Had we been advised beforehand that you were coming or the nature of the symptoms, we would have advised you go straight to the emergency hospital, but we did not get that opportunity. We did not charge you for the examination as we knew that you would incur another examination fee at the emergency hospital, and wanted to help out. We are very grateful that the emergency hospital was able to see you so quickly as we know just how busy they have been. We are so glad to work closely with such amazing emergency hospitals in this city as they provide emergency and specialist care for our patients when we are closed, or when we need to refer to a specialist.Not all hospitals have the same testing/facilities available that emergency hospitals have so our doctor followed standard protocol and deemed this the best course of action in order for your puppy to get the care he needed in a timely fashion. If you have any questions or would like to discuss this further, please don't hesitate to reach out to me. I can be reached at 416-690-0625 or reception@vetstoronto.comWarm regards,Fiona. Dear Winny, thank you for sharing your experience on not being covered.The complete oral exam is recommended for all new patients. The more your dentist knows about your overall health, the more effective they can be in addressing your oral health care needs. However, patients reserve the right to make informed decisions about their care, even if these decisions run counter to what's been recommended.Appointments are booked as per patient’s request. The appointment will only be booked once you confirm. Once the confirmation is received and reviewed, an e-mail is sent with the appointment details.Sometimes there are limitations on how often procedures will be covered, such as in this case, that one may not be aware of if they do not read the terms of the policy.Remember, we are treating you, not your dental plan! To learn more about what your coverage is, you’ll need to contact your insurance carrier. We reached out to you and have addressed your concerns.Sincerely,-The Cityview Dental Team

Thank you Andrea Mills, for leaving a review on your customer service experience. We have responded to your review prior and unfortunately it was deleted. However as indicated in our initial review, your father came into our dealership & purchased a vehicle that he would have shipped to Ghana. When the vehicle was at Ghana, he indicated to us that the radio was not working & we told him to provide us with the radio code, as we would use it to fix the issue. Your father did provide us with the the code and we sent it to Germany to resolve the issue. Unfortunately, the radio code was not the issue and we told your father to take the car to Mercedes- Benz and again he did do so. They informed him that the issue was the radio and he would need a replacement. We again had no issue replacing the radio for your father, asking him to provide us with the radio Id for the radio. After receiving the radio Id, we looked everywhere to find a compatible radio for your fathers vehicle. Every vehicle uses specific radio's you cannot put just any radio in a car even if it is the same make and model, this is where the use of a radio Id is needed. We finally found a compatible radio for your father's car, with the matching Id, it was suppose to be delivered on a Wednesday but unfortunately the radio did not arrive until the Thursday, we had to check the radio to make sure it would work with your fathers vehicle as we did take into consideration that the vehicle would be shipped to Ghana. We informed your that the part came to Bell Auto, however when you came into the dealership you had an issue with the fact that the radio had one knob missing, and we informed you to just remove the knob from the radio your father currently had. We kept the radio and you left the dealership. A couple of days later, we ordered a radio for one of our Mercedes- Benz that arrived at the dealership and was not compatible with the vehicle but it was a match for your fathers vehicle. We called you and informed you about this, before even thinking to return it to the parts location, to get the correct radio. We paid for the shipping to send it to Ghana which cost $200.00 plus tax and gave you the tracking number for the radio. We lost $1000.00 because the radio you did not want which was initially for your fathers vehicle passed the return days and could not be returned. The radio we supplied you with that was for one of our vehicle was also a loss of $1000.00 because we provided it to you and did not return it. As a company we went through a lot of trouble and still could not make you happy. However, we honestly hope you enjoy your new radio and thank you for your review.

We'd like to clear some things up. The pending charge amount is not always what will actually be posted to your account, and this is because a merchant may pre-authorize an amount before the transaction’s complete. This is often to make sure there are enough funds available before putting a charge through. In the case of dining at a restaurant, it's not uncommon for your issuer to preauthorize an additional 20% to allow room for tips. Just because it was preauthorized doesn't mean it was actually posted to your account, and we're sorry if it caused any worry. We've been serving our community for over 60 years, and our reputation is very important to us. We would never take advantage of our customers. All the best to you.

Thank you for your feedback. We understand your concerns about pricing and communication, particularly with dental surgery. Providing a precise estimate can be challenging, which is why we include a 20% variance to cover potential scenarios and the estimated time for extractions, as it’s difficult to give an exact quote until your pet is anesthetized. However, please know that the estimate you received initially and on the day of surgery remained the same.During the procedure, the veterinarian will call you to discuss the diagnostic results and go over the plan for extractions. This conversation will include any updated time estimates for the extractions and address any additional findings. Unfortunately, we cannot determine the exact time required to remove the teeth until your pet is under anesthesia and the necessary diagnostics have been completed.We apologize if our communication was unclear and led to any confusion. Our top priority is always the care and well-being of your pet, and we regret that this experience did not fully reflect our commitment to quality service. We value your feedback and will work on improving our processes. If you have any further concerns, please feel free to reach out directly.

Hello,I hope you are doing well. Our doctors best interest is to recommend the best course of treatment for every pet that we see in the practice, we want to make sure that we are exploring every concern through diagnostics if necessary so we can avoid missing any potential factors that can make our existing concerns worse. I completely understand if our prices may seem steep however we are happy to accomodate our clients capacity and provide alternatives if needed.We reached out to you at noon once the results were available and as explained by our staff, we tried our best to accomodate to every clients that we can eventhough our staff was limited at that time. We understand that this can be frustrating and we try to go out of our way to support our patients however we have a 0 tolerance policy on aggresive behaviour towards our team. This doesn't only undermine the well-being of our team members but also detracts from our ability to provide the exceptional service that our clients deserve. We understand that your emotions were running high which had caused you to raise your voice and interupt our Doctor constantly while he was talking to you however we do not appreciate your words and actions towards our team. Despite the challenges we faced all we wanted was to resolve the issue at hand in a respectful manner. Dr. Oscar had come in on a Sunday when the clinic is closed so he could call you and check-in, he made sure to ask our team to follow up with you on Monday which we did, and we made sure to fit you into our schedule so that we can see your pet in for a recheck which was free of charge.We acknowledge that not all recommendations and findings are easy to hear however we did try our best to communicate in a way that would please you. Our doctors work hard on a day-to-day basis to not only help our clinic but also help every patient that walks in and out of our hospital. They are also humans and they are entitled to get a little break once in a while. We welcome every client and we have never been discriminatory towards anyone in any way. Our team culture is founded on principles of diversity and inclusion and It's important to acknowledge that perspectives can vary, and it's possible that we may see things differently at times.We truly hope that you can find a clinic that will fit your needs.KrisPractice Manager

We understand that the mask and other important COVID protocols the clinic follows can be frustrating, but due to the size of our facility and the amount of staff we employ, it is a necessary precaution so we can continue to help other pets like yours.I know how muzzles can be upsetting, but unfortunately, when dealing with pets that are scared and/or in pain, sometimes they're necessary for the safety of your pet and our staff. The staff here have been trained in fear-free techniques, and when a pup is scared and/or in pain, the less stressful and safest way to examine a wound does mean sedation. This way, we can also make sure to do a thorough check for infection pockets and other complications that your pup wouldn't have allowed us to do while awake. Of course, it is your decision to decline if you so wish, but we are required to offer and explain all the options to make sure we're providing the best care possible.I really hope your pup is doing better, and if you want to continue this conversation, please don't hesitate to call or email the clinic and ask for me, Dr. Delgado, or Jane.Sincerely, Dr. Lucia Delgado

Susan,Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are very sorry to hear about the passing of your dear friend Mikki.I wanted to touch base on some of the concerns you raised in your review:It is rare and extremely unfortunate but yes, Veterinarians can report a case to Animal Services, where the recommended care is being declined. Patient's with very low prognosis and quality of life are recommended hospitalization or euthanasia in the pet's best interest. Should the owner's decline the recommended treatment for a sick pet, a waiver is signed and kept on the medical record.Mikki presented to us in a serious and painful medical condition, for which immediate treatment and action was required. Euthanasia and hospitalization were the two humane options given.Veterinarians are the medical advocates for our beloved pet's, but ultimately the decision is the client's.Mikki was very special to you, and I wish there was something else we could do.I'm truly sorry that you feel this way. I would like to welcome the opportunity to review Mikki's medical records or any further concerns with you.If there is anything we can do to support you or your family, we would be happy to do so.Sincerely,Belinda Gomes | ManagerAnimal Hospital of High Park416-763-4200

First of all, I want to thank you for sharing your feedback with us which we take very seriously and use to improve our patients' experience. Even though I cannot discuss the specifics of your procedure here due to privacy limitations, fortunately, we were able to talk over the phone. Hopefully, your concerns were resolved after our chat.In general, Root Canal is a complex procedure. As a result, a patient's recovery experience can be very different each time it is performed. I definitely appreciate that there is an expectation of having a similar recovery process, but due to the difference in the severity of the underlying problem, the post-operation recovery process can be quite different for each tooth. The most important factor is to have a successful treatment in the end that resolves the underlying issue long term. Having said that, I completely understand the recovery process for some dental procedures can be quite bothersome, but rest assured that we always do everything in our power to make it as smooth as possible.Lastly, I wanted to apologize for the miscommunication that you had with our office. I have spoken with our team to take the necessary steps to improve our follow-up calls.If you have any other questions or concerns, please feel free to email us at info@dentistryonking.net, and I will personally address them ASAP.With care,- Dr. Alavi

Hi Maneesha, Thank you for coming by for a haircut. While we are disappointed to hear that you don’t enjoy your haircut we do want to assure you that there are ways to maintain the volume in your hair after washing! During your corrective haircut appointment, our stylist added some more layers to create more dimension, volume, and movement in your hair. After washing your hair, we recommend blow drying your hair with a round brush to maintain the voluminous look you want. If you air dry your hair after washing, your hair’s texture and layers will fall flat. This could be the reason why you liked your hair while you were still at the salon and suddenly had a change of heart after your first wash. We hope that you’ll continue to love your haircut with our styling tip. Trust us, you’ll see lots of volume— just blow dry with a round brush after washing :)If you have any further concerns or questions for our stylists, kindly reach out to us at info@clsalon.com and we’d be happy to discuss.
